newsitem.title: LATVIA: SWEDFUND AGAINST UNIBANKA, ZEMES MERGER - REPORT.
newsitem.headline: SWEDFUND AGAINST UNIBANKA, ZEMES MERGER - REPORT.

text.p: Sweden's investment fund, Swedfund, which holds a stake in Latvia's Unibanka, supports the cancelation of the proposed merger between Unibanka and Zemes Bank, the Bizness & Baltija newspaper reported on Friday.
The heads of Unibanka and Zemes Bank in March said the merger, which has been planned for a year, was off on lack of synergies.
The European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), which holds a stake in both Unibanka and Zemes, earlier said the two should continue working as independent financial institutions.
Unibanka, the second biggest bank in Latvia in terms assets, had total capital of 19.91 million lats at the end of 1996.
Unibanka shareholders' meeting on June 21 will decide on the merger issue.
